form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cotton (for himself and Mr. Banks) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To subject aliens convicted of certain crimes to expedited removal from the United States.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Visas for Violent Criminals Act.

section.header: Immigration consequences for unlawful protest-related activities

subsection.text: Section 237(a)(2) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1227(a)(2)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Any alien who is convicted of a crime—

clause.text: related to the alien’s conduct at and during the course of a protest;
involving the defacement, vandalism, or destruction of Federal property; or
involving the intentional obstruction of any highway, road, bridge, or tunnel,

subsection.text: If any alien is convicted of a deportable crime described in section 237(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, as amended by subsection (a)—

paragraph.text: any visa issued to such alien shall immediately be cancelled; and
not later than 60 days after such conviction, such alien shall be removed from the United States.
